questions.question_text: A network contains 25 access points. Which of the following devices would be best to change configurations on all the devices remotely?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. WLAN controller

A WLAN (Wireless LAN) controller is designed to manage multiple access points centrally. It allows an administrator to change configurations, deploy updates, and monitor the status of all the connected access points from a single interface, making it the best option for managing a network with multiple access points remotely. This device streamlines the process of adjusting settings across the entire wireless network.

Selected Answer: C
C. MTBF

MTBF (Mean Time Between Failures) is used to estimate the average life span or reliability of a device. It is a measure of how reliable a hardware product or component is, and it predicts the time between inherent failures of a system during operation. MTBF is typically used in the context of hardware components, systems, or devices to represent average time periods when the device is expected to operate without failure under specified conditions.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is used to estimate the average life span of a device?
An IT administrator is creating an alias to the primary customer's domain. Which of the following DNS record types does this represent?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. CNAME

A CNAME (Canonical Name) record is used in the Domain Name System (DNS) to create an alias that points to another domain name, which is often referred to as the canonical domain name. This allows you to have multiple domain names pointing to the same IP address without having to create an A record for each one. It's commonly used to associate new subdomains with an existing domain's DNS records.

Selected Answer: A
A. It relies upon other layers for packet delivery.

The application layer in the OSI model is the topmost layer that provides the interface for end-user processes and applications to communicate over the network. It does not handle packet delivery directly; instead, it relies on the lower layers (like the transport and network layers) to ensure data is properly packaged, addressed, and transported.

Selected Answer: C
ncryption of data in transit, such as using protocols like HTTPS, is a responsibility of the application layer. Applications often implement encryption to ensure that data exchanged over the network is secure.

Selected Answer: A
It's A by process of elimination.

Selected Answer: C
I am going with this one

comments.content: the presentation layer is responsible for translating, encrypting, and decrypting data not the application layer
yup Im changing my answer to A. your right

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. It encrypts data in transit.

The application layer is responsible for providing network services directly to end-users or applications. One of the characteristics of the application layer is the ability to encrypt data in transit to ensure secure communication. Encryption is a process of encoding data to make it secure and confidential during transmission over the network. This is commonly seen in secure communication protocols used by applications such as HTTPS (HTTP Secure) for secure web browsing.

choices.A: It relies upon other layers for packet delivery.
choices.B: It checks independently for packet loss.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a characteristic of the application layer?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Split-tunnel VPN allows you to selectively route traffic through the VPN tunnel. In a split-tunnel configuration, only specific traffic destined for a particular network or destination is encrypted and sent through the VPN. Other traffic (such as internet browsing) bypasses the VPN and uses the regular internet connection.

Selected Answer: B
The question specifies to use for only encrypting and rounting data for "A SPECIFIC DESTINATION". Split tunnel has more than one destination, while Site-to-Site is specific to the 2 sites involved. But again, yet another poorly structured question!
B - Site to site. Says specific destination. Taking the test tomorrow, wish me luck.
I go for B site to site.

Selected Answer: A
A. Split-tunnel

A split-tunnel VPN is the best choice when you want to encrypt and route data for a specific destination. It allows for only part of the network traffic to be sent over the VPN, while the rest accesses the internet directly.

Selected Answer: B
I could be wrong but the question sounds like its directly talking about a sit to site vpn
